text: <@U0UFDAS91>:  Talking about Digital IDs, I just posted here - <https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/building-digital-ids-from-existing-contracts-marc-dangeard?trk=pulse_spock-articles> - how we manage this with CommonAccord. We use prototype inheritance which allows the use of a flexible list of attributes, maybe you will find it useful. Definitely relevant to the blockchain discussion once we get out of the pure automation (=smart contracts) and into the real world with actual contracts.

<@U0NQY299A>: i remember when nfc and mobile money were becoming a thing and having to put up with that nonsense. I am not going to do it the honour of writing it down. To be honest, I tend to find a specific country or demographic and name it. It'd be lazy of me not to do that. Whatever statistics I quote will be based on a specific demography anyway. If I were to coin a term, I would call it the "latent majority" with more of a ring of when innovation is adopted as opposed to imposing a power hierarchy on the world.
